document.discussion_title: Cricket NEWS: Brindle and Southern Vipers land first ever Super League T20 crown
document.topic_text: Search Cricket NEWS: Brindle and Southern Vipers land first ever Super League T20 crown LOUTH cricketer Arran Brindle is celebrating after her Southern Vipers side won the first ever Super League. It comes after their seven-wicket victory over Western Storm in yesterday's final at Chelmsford. Brindle – who captains the 2nd XI at London Road – was the pick of the bowlers as the Vipers restricted their opponents to 140 for five in 20 overs. She took two for 15 from her allocated spell. Read MORE: Batting sensation Brooker dreams of England future After the break, Brindle didn't stride out to the middle. But it mattered little as New Zealand star Suzie Bates scored a fine... read more Cricket NEWS: Cleethorpes CC gunning to make it a Yorkshire League double TOMORROW sees Cleethorpes CC head to Sheffield & Phoenix United looking to complete a Yorkshire ECB Premier League South double. The two sides were in opposition at Chichester Road at the end of May, when the Meggies ran out winners by 33 runs.... Grimsby Telegraph , 17 June 2016 in Yorkshire & Humber VIDEO - Red Arrows flyover at first-ever Elland vintage event Hundreds of visitors to Elland's first ever vintage event this weekend were treated to a special flyover from the Red Arrows. The Rotary Club of Elland had been planning the showpiece event for the past year and now hopes it will become an annual... Todmorden News , 20 September 2015 in Yorkshire & Humber
